item.title: Report E-2024090443
item.description:
Report E-2024090443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, at 1111 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hebron, Ohio regarding the release of STRONTIUM CHROMATE 176. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 pound of Strontium Chromate 176 (UN3077, 9, III) from (1) 1000 lb. supersack. The release was caused by a collapsed pallet and impacted a 1ft x 6ft area of the trailer floor. Contractors were able to successfully patch the hole in the punctured supersack then placed it in a lined gaylord. The release was collected with the proper PPE and placed in a metal drum. Another supersack that was undamaged but was on top of a collapsed pallet was also placed into a lined gaylord as a precaution. All cargo was unloaded, unwrapped, restacked and rewrapped onto new pallets before being reloaded onto the trailer. All waste was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090477
item.description:
Report E-2024090477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3066 had a loose cap and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3066-impacted trailer. The damaged pail and all impacted waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. Fifteen (15) additional pails were severely impacted and, per R+L, were palletized and gift wrapped. The waste drums and pallet of impacted pails were staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090463
item.description:
Report E-2024090463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-23T09:15:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 01:33 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately a quarter of a gallon of UN1263 Master Pro Refinishing Metal Strip released from a metal can due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer #3212046. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The damaged metal can and clean up debris were containerized into a 20-gallon drum, which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024091114
item.description:
Report X-2024091114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: MIAMISBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/10/2024 at apporximately 1630, Dangerous Goods Administraton received a call from Employee 3836150 at the station location in Miamisburg, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jerrican, packaged in a fiberboard box. Due to human error, the shipment spilled from the closure. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits either an amended shipper's declaration or a customer pick-up.

item.title: Report E-2024090414
item.description:
Report E-2024090414

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: AKRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of organic peroxide had a damaged cap and released approximately two (2) ounces to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbent rags to the impacted drum, and neutralized the exterior. A replacement cap was then used to fix the drum. The drum was staged on the truck for future shipping. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented drum and was taken to the Columbiana terminal for future disposal.

  • Description: During the process of loading freight into the trailer where the tote was already loaded, a protruding piece of wood from a broken pallet punctured the tote. The IBC container was immediately contained to reduce further release. The released material was neutralized, absorbed and containerized for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090369
item.description:
Report E-2024090369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Swisher Hercules was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Swisher Hercules-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews neutralized the absorbents and spilled materials and utilized pH test strips. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) damaged pail of Swisher Hercules was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: At 0416 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of 960BK177 DO HAP33 Liner Black was released from a 55-gallon DM due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3172891. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized in in 65-gallon poly drum which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 16:15 PM ET, XCN contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside trailer in West Chester, OH. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Surfink Bag Color, which was released from 1â€“55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture by the shipper when they loaded the container onto the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal. Terminal cleaned the spill with absorbents and placed the contents into a 65-gallon metal drum with plastic lining. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080745
item.description:
Report E-2024080745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/22/2024, at 1353 hours, CSXT personnel at the Walbridge Yard discovered FHRX135943, a loaded tank car of Sulfur, Molten, with a vapor release from the connection between the manway nozzle and the manway cover. The car was isolated and the shipper, Marathon Petroleum Company, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024082200196). CSXT Hazardous Materials Manager Scott Karcher found the manway gasket to be improperly installed (misaligned) which allowed for a vapor release. The damaged gasket was removed, a new gasket was installed, and the manway was secured for transportation. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Jennifer Johnson 209-986-1196). This incident did require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required.

item.title: Report E-2024090312
item.description:
Report E-2024090312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of DOWSILâ„¢ PR-1200 RTV Prime Coat Clear was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3191638. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.
